data.title: Fix Matrix#set and other small changes
data.body:
Fix scaling in Matrix4#set(translation, quaternion, scale) to match FBX, see #1289.
Added Matrix4#set(translation, quaternion) and added the same methods with float arguments.
Slightly changed the existing Matrix4#set(quaternion) method to remove a few multiplications.
Added docs to the Matrix4#Mxx members with (where possible) a simple example of the value usage.
Also add some docs to the Shader interface
Add some convenience methods to Frustum.

data.title: Rewrite TextureAtlas system to support Json files
data.body: Using the Json Serializer classes, TextureAtlas has been rewritten to support simple Json formatted files.  It's still capable of loading legacy atlas files.  This is done to prevent code duplication of parsing and writing between the loader and the TexturePacker classes.  Additionally, this is done to create a cleaner format that is not reliant on needing an entire specialized parser for something used by only one aspect of a system.

data.title: Add support for iOS application types in the MipMapGenerator
data.body:
Added support for iOS application types in the MipMapGenerator utility class.  This tells libGDX to use the OGL ES2 glGenerateMipmap() call to create mipmaps, instead of the CPU-based code.  One major advantage to this fix is that you can now use non-square textures on iOS.

TESTED: built and ran on iOS simulator and on an iPknoe 4 using a small test app that applies a single-channel non-square (but POT, it was 1024 x 512) texture to the faces of a cube.

data.title: Added particles 3d classes
data.body:
Added particled editor 3d
Added functions to create xyz coordinates and a grid of lines models

data.title: /tmp exec
data.body:
If /tmp mounted with "noexec" desktop compiled program just won't init. Maybe some sort of warning should be added into lib?

Here, it checks if it can write but does not check exec permission:

SharedLibraryLoader.java
private File getExtractedFile (String dirName, String fileName) 

There is other method:
private void loadFile (String sourcePath)

which checks actual exec and used a bit before. Not sure why 2 of them are used :/

data.title: Unsatisfied link error
data.body:
Hello, lately i'm getting this error in my libGDX based game
Could you assist what's wrong?

For now i'm guessing that it has something to do with the fact that the game is not able to load OGL 2.0 because it's not supported on that device but i have the same issue on Galaxy S4.. which should support it

java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: dlopen failed: empty/missing DT_HASH in "libandroidgl20.so" (built with --hash-style=gnu?)
at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary(Runtime.java:362)
at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:525)
at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidGL20.<clinit>(Unknown Source)
at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidGraphics.setupGL(Unknown Source)
at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidGraphics.onSurfaceCreated(Unknown Source)
at android.opengl.GLSurfaceView$GLThread.guardedRun(GLSurfaceView.java:1509)
at android.opengl.GLSurfaceView$GLThread.run(GLSurfaceView.java:1248)

List of devices and OS
gs702a, Galaxy S4 (jfltespr), rk2928sdk, Optimus One (thunderc)
Android 4.1, Android 4.3, Android 2.3.3 - 2.3.7

data.title: Entry value null after using ObjectMap.Entries.remove()
data.body:
Hi there,

the bug occurs when I iterate over an ObjectMap with an ObjectMap.Entries object and use the  remove() method of the entries object. The value of the next entry object returned by next() after using remove() is null sometimes. I found out that this only seems to happen when the method ObjectMap.removeStashIndex() is used within the remove() method and only when the currentIndex is not equal to the lastIndex.

Greetings

data.title: Fixed AndroidVisibilityListener's Javadoc
data.body: Old description wasn't 100% accurate. This clarifies what the class actually does.

data.title: Updated HeaderFixer to the current year
[RoboVM]Textures with MipMaps not drawn
data.body:
It seems like using a MipMap TextureFilter with the RoboVM backend on IOS prevents the textures from being drawn on the screen. Instead black squares get rendered. Switching the filter to Linear or Nearest fixes the problem. I can only test this in the IPhoneSimulator on OS X, maybe its no issue with real devices.
![iphonemipmap](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/468951/2090161/558dc094-8e90-11e3-98f7-52dfd213ce45.png)

I took the demo project supplied with the gdx-setup and added the TextureFilter to create a minimal example of the bug. [You can download it here](http://www.mediafire.com/download/81lsz75nszks1o3/iosmipmaps.zip)

data.title: Headless: Added support for opening URIs
data.body:
This may not be supported on all environments. I have added the necessary checks and balances to make sure it doesn't crash on not supported environments. 

I felt that this should be implemented because if someone is say running a server and they have a desktop environment installed on the machine as well this function could then be put to use. If there is no desktop environment (or supported one) it does the original behavior.

data.title: GWT: Fixed SuperJumper compile error
data.body:
System.nanoTime() is not implemented in GWT. Switched to TimeUtils instead. 
Minor Formatting

data.title: Update FPSLogger to use nanoTime.
data.body:
"currentTimeMillsis" pulls time from the system clock and should not be used to measure elapsed time. Other processes like NTP, or the user, can alter the system clock and the time returned can unexpectedly shift and create bizarre and intermittent behavior.

"nanoTime" is a measure of nanoseconds from some arbitrary time point and is safe for measuring elapsed time.

The results of this bug are rather benign â€“ worst case the time is changed back and you would not get a framerate log message for that time, or until the user restarts the program. However, this flavor of bug can cause significant intermittent issues if present in other areas if the user is unfortunate enough to have his clock changed while he is playing (this happens more than you may think thanks to NTP keeping our system clocks in sync.)

See: 
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/System.html#nanoTime%28%29
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/System.html#currentTimeMillis%28%29

BTW: This edit was done in the browser and is untested. I don't know the ramifications for this on platforms other than the desktop.

data.title: Bugfix 1283 json anon enum
data.body: Now doesn't use any GWT non-existant reflection calls.

data.title: Stage, make some TouchFocuses parameters public
Pool should not duplicate objects
data.body:
I suggest adding the following line of code in the free() method of Pool class to avoid having to add an object already exists in the Pool:

```
            if (freeObjects.contains(object, false)) return;
```

data.title: Models rotation not imported from g3db.
data.body: After updating to latest nightly build model rotations imported from g3db are ignored.

data.title: Added Android SDK License
data.body: This license was needed to get the android.jar for 4.4. Since we include the android sdk jar, we probably should include the license.

data.title: Cancel HTTP request
data.body: Adds a cancelHttpRequest method to the Net interface as requested in #915.

data.title: Fragment based libgdx in Android back-end
data.body: Added some minor abstraction of the AndroidApplication class to operate through an interface, so that a fragment can implement the same Application interface as an activity. Also added an implementation for the  Fragment superclass that clients will extend, in the AndroidFragmentApplication class.

data.title: Stage, add "getTouchFocusesSize" method
data.body: Very useful for me and maybe will be for someone else.

data.title: Fix for enum serialization when enums where anonymous innerclasses (impl...
data.body:
Fixes #1283 
De-Serialization of enums with anonymous innerclasses broken. (e.g. implementing abstract logic in enum base class)

data.title: Json Serialization bug: Anonymous Innerclass Enum
Down drawable in Button is no longer drawn when clearListeners is called
data.body:
Since the draw method of Button checks isPassed of its clickListener field, when you call clearListeners and add a new ClickListener it no longer works properly.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Define a Button with different up and down drawables.
2. Call clearListeners and add a new ClickListener
3. When you press the button, image no longer changes to "down".

I'm using 0.9.9 but I can see the problem persists in the latest version too.

data.title: Updated CONTRIBUTING.MD to match version on wiki
Updated gdx-remote to Android 4.4
data.body: Removed unneeded wakelock permission as well

data.title: Sprite, fixed position for some constructors
assertLoader progress (and toLoad) values are wrong when resource load directive is directly following with the same resource unload
NPE in ReflectionPool
data.body: ReflectionPool.newObject may throw an NPE instead of the expected RuntimeException if no default constructor is found.

data.title: Pregenerated mip-maps
data.body: Currently there appears to be no way to use pre-generated mipmaps (which would be nice for using fancy offline filtering) - only to generate them at texture load time.
